name: State_5

timeline_beats.label: Rise of port-kings and chartered guilds
Great Naval War (major naval battles nearby)
Territorial shifts after the Great Naval War
Open-Seas Treaty enacted; sea lanes codified
Formal entry into Maritime Trading League / Sea Trade Union

factions.label: Port Aristocracy (House Kera et al.)
factions.influence_hint: Controls major harbors, seats in trade council

factions.label: Shipwrights' Guild
factions.influence_hint: Monopoly on large-ship construction and naval repairs

factions.label: Coastal Militias & Smugglers
factions.influence_hint: Local power in outer isles and informal trade

external_relations_refs.label_hint: Territorial Shifts after Great Naval War

constraints: No instant resurrection or true life-replacement magics
Long-range mind influence is rare and institutionally banned
Navigational auguries cannot replace charts or seamanship
Ritual magic consumes scarce imported reagents or specialized labor
Combustion-derived industry limited; no high-pressure steam megatechs
Must respect Open-Seas Treaty (T1) and post-war border realities (BC4)
notes: High dependency on imported ritual reagents â€” supply vulnerability
Outer Isles underwent jurisdictional change after BC4; local loyalties divided
Port Aristocracy vs. Guilds is primary internal political tension
Naval infrastructure concentrated in Kera Harbor and North Dock
